attributes.action: That there should be a review of the sentence given to Tomasz Kroker.
attributes.additional_details: Why is this sentence not 4 x 10 years? and a lifetime driving ban?
attributes.background: On the 8th September 2016 Tomasz Kroker was using his mobile phone whilst driving and ploughed into 4 stationary vehicles, on the A34,in the process a whole family were wiped out.The judge handed out a sentence of 10 years in the trial which ended today (31 October 2016).

rejection.details:
Sentences are the responsibility of the courts, which are independent of the Government and Parliament.

Anyone can ask the Attorney General to review a sentence they think is too low, and only one person needs to ask for a sentence to be reviewed. You can find out how to do that here:

https://www.gov.uk/complain-about-low-crown-court-sentence
